definition: to drive away/to force out/to repel
to overtake/to catch up with/to hurry/to rush/to try to catch (the bus etc)/to drive (cattle etc) forward/to drive (sb) away/to avail oneself of (an opportunity)/until
to run/to run away/to escape/to run around (on errands etc)/(of a gas or liquid) to leak or evaporate/(verb complement) away/off

sentences.english: Vanessa shot out of the car wielding a monkey wrench and faced the guy down.
sentences.chinese: 瓦妮莎冲下车，操着一把活动扳手把他赶跑了。

sentences.english: An 81-year-old would-be victim chased the intruder off with a gun.
sentences.chinese: 一位差点成为受害者的81岁老太用枪赶跑了入侵者。

sentences.english: The villagers drove the invaders away in a fight flashing with knives and swords.
sentences.chinese: 在一场刀光剑影的格斗中，村民们把侵略者赶跑了。

sentences.english: I heard someone running the cattle off last night.
sentences.chinese: 昨天夜里我听见有人偷偷把牛赶跑了。

sentences.english: The noisy activity quickly put down the fish.
sentences.chinese: 吵闹的响声很快赶跑了鱼群。

sentences.english: The young man set about him with a stick until her had driven the wolves off.
sentences.chinese: 这个年轻人拿着根棍子左右乱打，直到把狼群赶跑。

sentences.english: We saw a hare jumping into our garden and ran it off.
sentences.chinese: 我们看见一只野兔窜入花园里，便把它赶跑了。

sentences.english: Cloudy sky drove the bathers off the beach.
sentences.chinese: 阴霾的天空把海滩上的游客都赶跑了。

definition: to run off rebuffed/to fend off/(to fight off and make sb) run off
to drive (vehicle)/to drive out/to chase away/to herd (people towards a gate)
to put an end to/to annihilate/to cause to perish/to perish/annihilation (in quantum field theory)
to defeat/to overpower/to beat/to be defeated
to be fair/to be impartial/to settle (a matter etc)
